page.title: 15HOUSING
page.content: HOUSING The housing of the Port Tennant area is mixed. The houses on the wetern edge of the study area were mainly built in the last quarter of the C19th and the first years of C20th. The houses which come into the extreme east of the study area are those belonging to the Gelli_Grafog council estate, built to accomodate the workers of the Tir John Power Station which was near at hand. Street names such as William Morris Gdns. and David Williams Tce. were given to commemorate Labour PaRty slalwarts. Other street names are Hoo, Crymlyn and Grai. Alarge number of these houses are, therefore, tenanted, but here and there can be seen houses with individual touches uncharacteristic of a council estate, which shows that they have been purchased.
